channel.title: CVE Feed for SierraWireless -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SierraWireless -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-40461|2024-08-02T18:31:53.903Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
The ACEManager component of ALEOS 4.16 and earlier allows an
authenticated user with Administrator privileges to access a file
upload field which does not fully validate the file name, creating a
Stored Cross-Site Scripting condition.

item.title: CVE-2023-40465|2024-08-02T18:31:53.825Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
Several versions of ALEOS, including ALEOS 4.16.0, include an opensource
third-party component which can be exploited from the local
area network, resulting in a Denial of Service condition for the captive portal.

item.title: CVE-2023-40464|2024-08-02T18:31:54.059Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
Several versions of ALEOS, including ALEOS 4.16.0, use a hardcoded
SSL certificate and private key. An attacker with access to these items
could potentially perform a man in the middle attack between the
ACEManager client and ACEManager server.

item.title: CVE-2023-40460|2024-08-02T18:31:53.807Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
The ACEManager component of ALEOS 4.16 and earlier does not
validate uploaded file names and types, which could potentially allow
an authenticated user to perform client-side script execution within
ACEManager, altering the device functionality until the device is
restarted.

item.title: CVE-2023-40463|2024-08-02T18:31:53.894Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
When configured in debugging mode by an authenticated user with
administrative privileges, ALEOS 4.16 and earlier store the SHA512
hash of the common root password for that version in a directory
accessible to a user with root privileges or equivalent access.

item.title: CVE-2023-40459|2024-08-02T18:31:53.799Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description: The ACEManager component of ALEOS 4.16 and earlier does not adequately perform input sanitization during authentication, which could potentially result in a Denial of Service (DoS) condition for ACEManager without impairing other router functions. ACEManager recovers from the DoS condition by restarting within ten seconds of becoming unavailable.

item.title: CVE-2023-40458|2024-08-02T18:31:53.809Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop') vulnerability in Sierra Wireless, Inc ALEOS could potentially allow a remote attacker to trigger a Denial of Service (DoS) condition for ACEManager without impairing other router functions. This condition is cleared by restarting the device.

item.title: CVE-2023-40462|2024-08-02T18:31:53.985Z -- sierrawireless -- aleos
item.description:
The ACEManager component of ALEOS 4.16 and earlier does not
perform input sanitization during authentication, which could
potentially result in a Denial of Service (DoS) condition for
ACEManager without impairing other router functions. ACEManager
recovers from the DoS condition by restarting within ten seconds of
becoming unavailable.
